StructuredXMLResume.ExecutiveSummary: * An erudite B.Tech. (CSE) professional zealous to start the career as an entry-level in Business Analytics with a reputed firm * Offering 10 months' experience in Data Analysis * Excellent aptitude in supporting data-driven decisions and working with different teams to gather data, measure business performance & produce valuable conclusions that can help companies make informed decisions on the future of the business * Talented Analyst with exceptional background in utilizing data from diverse information systems to build tools and forecasting models that remarkably improve organizational decision making capabilities * Skilled in data acquisition & extraction, data analysis (quantitative and qualitative), data presentation and reporting; proficient in analysing & presenting conclusions gained from analyzing data * Expertise in preparing financial operational reports in form of charts, graphs & tables

PositionHistory.Title: Data Analyst
PositionHistory.Description:
Key Result Areas: * Ensuring the deadlines for Actuarial processes are being met and high quality product is delivered * Developing & implementing data analyses, data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality * Acquiring data from primary or secondary data sources and maintaining databases * Analysing data using MY-SQL, Excel (Advanced), Python, R Programming, In-House Tools, Excel VBA for automation of company speci?c Tools as well as rectifying huge data for ensuring quality product delivery * Using statistical methods to analyze data and generate useful business reports
https://freesearch.naukri.com/preview/printResume?uname=836 00809030f211d4e58485f0f1207006&sid=3810263223&AT=1580680858 2/2/20 23&01
* Performing data acquisition & extraction, data analysis (quantitative and qualitative), data presentation and reporting * Presenting client specific actionable information in the form of daily, weekly and monthly reports; preparing executive reports showing the performance of the business unit against the goals * Delivering KPI reports to clients and stakeholders using presentations / diagrams; reviewing reports and data to ensure errorless process of merging/de-duplication of customer records
Highlights: * Won "You Have Earned It" (YHEI) for exceptional performance for Jul'19- Sep'19 quarter in Oct'19 * Conferred with "Pat On The Back" at AXA XL for excellent performance and smart work shown within the organisation in August 2019 * Automated various processes using Python and R which saved the time in manual data fetching & analysis

JobCategory.Comments: Information Technology describes 49% of this job

Degree.Comments: UG: B.Tech/B.E. (CSE) from Jaypee Institute of Information Technology in 2019

SpeakingEvent.Description: Delivering KPI reports to clients and stakeholders using presentations / diagrams; reviewing reports and data to

sov:Findings.sov:Information: [Sovren:301;] Neither an email address nor a phone number were found in the contact information. A resume should always include both.

[Sovren:303;5] The following section in the resume contains more content than the work history and education sections combined: 'IT Skills'. This may indicate a problem with section headers, formatting, or content.
[Sovren:323;SKILLS] The following section type appeared multiple times in the resume: SKILLS (2 occurrences). Each section type should only appear once in a resume.
[Sovren:211;] An email address was not found in the contact information. A resume should always include an email address.
[Sovren:212;] A phone number was not found in the contact information. A resume should always include a phone number.
[Sovren:213;] A street level address was not found in the contact information. A full contact address should always be included in a resume as it allows for location based searches.

[Sovren:112;] The following sections were identified as a skills section type: 'Key Skills', 'IT Skills'. Skills should not be in a separate section, but instead, each skill should be included in the descriptions of work history or education.
[Sovren:123;] Marital status should not be included in a resume (for most cultures).

[Sovren:151;0,4] The following sections do not have the header on a separate line: 'Key Skills', 'Qualifications/Certifications/Programs:'. Every section should have a clear, unambiguous, commonly-used header on a separate line directly above the content associated with it.
